page.title: About Us
page.html:
Esparter Ltd.

Smart web applications, simplified.

Esparter utilises the latest proven technology and best practice to design, develop and support custom browser and mobile applications. 

At Esparter we are combining decades of experience in the fintech sectors of banking and financial markets, together with a passion for creating a new breed of web applications and services.

This drive has come from delivering many complex web projects in the real-time transaction and trading space, through the maturing of browser development best practice of the last 10 to 15 years, to the point now where, by using the appropriate new packages, tools and processes, smart web and mobile applications can be designed, engineered, supported and securely managed through these reusable components, much more efficiently and cost effectively than has been possible before now.

Esparter will consult with you on your vision and collaborate throughout the plan, design and project phases to ensure you get the application you want for your users. Esparter can also help you deploy and support the application in a full service offering.

To learn more about what Esparter does, explore the Esparter Digital Service Playbook

Management Team

Adam Hawley – Managing Director

Adam has 25 years experience in web and transaction focused technology with Logica (now part of CGI), Caplin Systems and Esparter, predominantly in the finance sector.

Adam is focused on helping steer IT developments towards the greatest value and highest business impact, both for Esparter’s customers and the users of their services.

James Turner – Technical Director

James is an experienced software architect, agile practitioner and full stack web developer who specialises in designing and building large and complex, real-time web apps.

Esparter – What’s in the name?

Esparto grass is an organic fibre produced from two species of perennial grasses of north Africa and southern Europe. It was used to make a whole variety of items, dating back 7000 years and is still used today. Items include baskets, rugs, ropes, floor coverings, paper, espadrilles and even walls for out-houses. In southern Spain there is an “Esparto culture”: a deep knowledge about the many uses of this fibre forms part of the traditions of these communities. As a carpenter is for wood, a craftsman for Esparto grass is an Esparter.

We love the symbolism of using deep knowledge of raw materials to weave them together and create something useful. At Esparter we build and support web apps by ‘weaving’ together the best and most appropriate open source frameworks and components available.

By happy coincidence Espartero is also a rather nice Rioja wine.
